intro: Ischnosiphon ovatus, commonly known as the oval-leaf ischnosiphon, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite, and oval-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, featuring four petals and prominent stamens. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical regions.
